standards.header: Hospital leaders support patient and family education.

details.header: The hospital develops policies and procedures to ensure effective patient and family education process.
There is an appropriate structure and efficient resources for patient/family education throughout the hospital.

According to the size of the hospital and its scope of services, the hospital assigns adequate health educators to cover the needs of patient/family education (e.g., diabetic educator, nurse educator).
The hospital provides different teaching methods for the health education process such as pamphlets, diagrams, models to practice on, videos, or other teaching methods.
The job description of the clinical staff (e.g. nurses, physicians, dietitians) reflects their role in patient/family education.
Clinical staff and health educators are knowledgeable about their essential role in patient education.
There are discussions of patient education efforts in staff meetings as an integral part of the care process.

standards.header: The hospital ensures proper communication between the health educator and the patient/family.

details.header: Patient/family education is provided in an easy language understandable by the patient/family.
Sufficient time is provided to allow the patient to understand the information provided and interact with the health educator.

standards.header: Each patient’s educational needs are assessed and planned.

details.header: Staff conduct educational needs assessment for every patient by:
details: Assessing caregiver/patient’s readiness and ability to learn.
Assessing patient’s capability and motivation to provide self-care.
Assessing caregiver/patient’s appropriate educational materials and methods that meet their learning skills.
Assessing who will provide care after discharge (caregiver and/or patient).

details.header: Staff use the assessment findings for planning and delivery of education as appropriate to the plan of care.
Staff provide the caregiver/patient with educational materials that meet their learning skills (e.g. written and verbal notes, pictures, demonstration).
When the patient is unable/unsuitable to learn (e.g., comatose, child, mentally disabled), education is provided to the family or the caregiver.

standards.header: Patients and their families receive education to help them give informed consent, participate in care process, and understand any financial implications of care choices.

details.header: Patients and families are educated about informed consent.
Patients and families are educated about participation in the care process and decisions.
Patients and families are educated about any financial implications of care decisions.

standards.header: Patients and their families are given the necessary education and information by clinical staff and health educators as appropriate to their needs.

details.header: The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the primary illness and all possible complications.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about infection control practices, adding emphasis on basic hand washing.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the required treatments and procedures.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the appropriate and safe use of the medical equipment or appliances.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about any surgical procedure needed and its benefits and potential risks.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the pre- operative preparations needed and their importance.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about post- operative care (e.g., breathing exercises, diet, and wound care).
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the necessary medications, the frequency, potential side effects, and food-drug interactions.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about radiological procedures, their benefits, and the potential risks involved.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the rational and benefits of any dietary restrictions.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about the conditions in which the patient needs to seek medical assistance and how to access it if necessary.
The hospital ensures that the patient has his follow up clinic appointments.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about how to carry out activities of daily living.
The hospital provides the patient with the necessary education and information about community resources for additional care and how to access emergency services if necessary.
The hospital ensures that the patient can always state the name of his most responsible physician.

standards.header: The patient/family education is evaluated for effectiveness.

details.header: Clinical staff and health educators obtain feedback from the patient and/or family to ensure proper understanding (e.g., demonstrates learning, verbalizes understanding).

standards.header: All patient education activities are documented in the patient's medical record.

details.header: The educational needs assessment and planning is documented in the patient's medical record.
The patient's response to education is documented in the patient's medical record.
